abstract_problem:
A transportation provider plans a set of profitable vehicle operations while simultaneously building a feasible crew plan that can cover those operations. Both the vehicle side and the crew side are represented as discrete time-space transitions: selecting a transition means committing to a specific movement or linkage in the plan.

During the planning horizon, there are {num_start_slots} independent starting requirements. For each requirement, exactly one starting option must be chosen so that a corresponding operational stream can begin.

Some operational blocks are only meaningful if they are opened and properly “anchored” at both ends. The instance contains {num_packages} such blocks. When a block is opened, exactly two associated boundary choices must be selected, reflecting that the block must have a valid start and a valid end within the overall plan.

Operational activity is also paced across {num_windows} windows. In each window, the number of selected vehicle-side transitions must remain within a window-specific band and must not exceed a hard limit. In addition, there are {num_mix_dimensions} policy dimensions that limit how concentrated certain vehicle-side attributes can be among the selected transitions.

The plan must also satisfy minimum coverage expectations across {num_coverage_groups} groups and avoid incompatible combinations captured by {num_conflict_groups} conflict groups. Finally, some choices only make sense when at least one supporting continuation is also chosen.

Each selectable choice has a net cost that can be positive (expense) or negative (profit credit). The goal is to select a consistent set of choices that respects all operational rules and yields the minimum total net cost.

decisions.description:
All selectable choices in the plan. Each row is one binary choice with its role label and its net cost contribution in the objective. The decision identifier uses a stable, cleaned format.

Possible strings:
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.
- role: one of {vehicle_arc_or_trip, crew_block_or_vehicle_block, auxiliary_transition}.

Data format: | decision_id | role | cost |
|:--|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> | <float> |
| ... | ... | ... |

start_slots.description:
Independent starting requirements. Each row identifies a start slot that must select exactly one associated option.

Possible strings:
- start_slot_id: 'S' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., S00.

Data format: | start_slot_id |
|:--|
| <str> |
| ... |

start_options.description:
Allowed starting options for each start slot. The options listed for a slot are the choices among which exactly one must be selected.

Possible strings:
- start_slot_id: 'S' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., S00.
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.

Data format: | start_slot_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

flow_nodes.description:
Time-space balance nodes used to ensure internal consistency of vehicle and crew movement streams. Each node has a required net balance value.

Possible strings:
- node_id: 'c' followed by digits, e.g., c22. These identifiers label balance equations (nodes) in the time-space representation.

Data format: | node_id | rhs |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <float> |
| ... | ... |

flow_arcs.description:
Directed transitions between flow nodes for decisions that follow the standard ‘leave one node and enter another’ pattern. Selecting such a decision contributes positively at the origin node and negatively at the destination node.

Possible strings:
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.
- from_node, to_node: 'c' followed by digits, e.g., c22.

Data format: | decision_id | from_node | to_node |
|:--|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... | ... |

flow_exceptions.description:
Non-standard balance contributions for decisions that do not fit the simple directed-transition pattern. Each row adds an explicit coefficient to the specified node equation.

Possible strings:
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.
- node_id: 'c' followed by digits, e.g., c22.

Data format: | decision_id | node_id | coef |
|:--|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> | <float> |
| ... | ... | ... |

packages.description:
Operational blocks that, when opened, must be anchored by selecting exactly two associated boundary choices. Each row links a block identifier to the decision that represents opening it.

Possible strings:
- package_id: 'P' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., P000.
- package_decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.

Data format: | package_id | package_decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

package_candidates.description:
Boundary choices associated with each operational block. These are the only choices that can be used to anchor the block.

Possible strings:
- package_id: 'P' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., P000.
- candidate_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.

Data format: | package_id | candidate_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

windows.description:
Pacing windows that limit how much vehicle-side activity can be scheduled in the window. Each row provides the allowed band and a hard upper limit.

Possible strings:
- window_id: 'W' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., W00.

Data format: | window_id | min_count | max_count | hard_cap |
|:--|:--|:--|:--|
| <str> | <float> | <float> | <float> |
| ... | ... | ... | ... |

window_members.description:
Membership of decisions in each pacing window. A decision listed under a window contributes to that window’s activity count.

Possible strings:
- window_id: 'W' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., W00.
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.

Data format: | window_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

mix_targets.description:
Share-limit targets for each policy dimension. These targets bound how concentrated certain vehicle-side attributes may be among selected vehicle-side decisions.

Possible strings:
- mix_dimension_id: 'D' followed by digits, e.g., D0.

Data format: | mix_dimension_id | max_share |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <float> |
| ... | ... |

mix_flags.description:
Binary attribute flags for vehicle-side decisions under each policy dimension. These flags are used together with the share targets to enforce mix limits.

Possible strings:
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.
- mix_dimension_id: 'D' followed by digits, e.g., D0.

Data format: | decision_id | mix_dimension_id | flag |
|:--|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> | <int> |
| ... | ... | ... |

coverage_groups.description:
Minimum coverage expectations. Each row defines a group and the minimum number of selected decisions required in that group.

Possible strings:
- coverage_group_id: 'G' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., G000.

Data format: | coverage_group_id | min_selected |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <int> |
| ... | ... |

coverage_members.description:
Membership of decisions in each coverage group. A decision listed under a group counts toward that group’s minimum coverage.

Possible strings:
- coverage_group_id: 'G' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., G000.
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.

Data format: | coverage_group_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

conflict_groups.description:
Groups of mutually incompatible choices. For each group, at most one member decision may be selected.

Possible strings:
- conflict_group_id: 'C' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., C000.

Data format: | conflict_group_id |
|:--|
| <str> |
| ... |

conflict_members.description:
Membership of decisions in each incompatibility group.

Possible strings:
- conflict_group_id: 'C' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., C000.
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.

Data format: | conflict_group_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

dependencies.description:
Prerequisite links between choices. If a parent choice is selected, at least one of its listed child choices must also be selected.

Possible strings:
- parent_id, child_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.

Data format: | parent_id | child_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

exact_choice_groups.description:
Groups where an exact number of member choices must be selected. These encode small mutually exclusive selections or fixed-size selections of boundary choices for a block.

Possible strings:
- exact_group_id: 'X' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., X000.

Data format: | exact_group_id | required_selected |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <int> |
| ... | ... |

exact_choice_members.description:
Membership of decisions in each exact-choice group.

Possible strings:
- exact_group_id: 'X' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., X000.
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.

Data format: | exact_group_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

cardinality_caps.description:
Upper limits on how many member choices may be selected in a group.

Possible strings:
- cap_group_id: 'K' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., K000.

Data format: | cap_group_id | max_selected |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <int> |
| ... | ... |

cardinality_cap_members.description:
Membership of decisions in each cardinality-cap group.

Possible strings:
- cap_group_id: 'K' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., K000.
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.

Data format: | cap_group_id | decision_id |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <str> |
| ... | ... |

redundant_bounds.description:
Optional traceability bounds that are implied by the binary nature of the decisions and therefore do not change feasibility. Keeping them allows exact auditing against the source model.

Possible strings:
- decision_id: 'd' followed by digits (zero-padded), e.g., d00000.

Data format: | decision_id | upper_bound |
|:--|:--|
| <str> | <int> |
| ... | ... |
